dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my goodness. Did you see this? This Akim guy, Erbolat Dossaev?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my goodness. Did you see this? This Akim guy, Erbolat Dossaev?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I did, yeah. It’s, um, quite the exchange, isn’t it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I did, yeah. It's, um, quite the exchange, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quite the exchange? I mean, a resident is there, like, complaining about no women in power, saying it affects efficiency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quite the exchange? I mean, a resident is there, like, complaining about no women in power, saying it affects efficiency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A resident of Almaty complained to Akim (governor) Erbolat Dossaev about the lack of women in power. ... "I would also like to raise the issue of women's representation in decision-making. Just look" all the akimat representatives are men. There are no women. Maybe that affects the efficiency of the work," the Almaty resident said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, she’d submitted, like, over 200 requests for housing, and she felt ignored. So, she brought up the representation issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, she'd submitted, like, over two hundred requests for housing, and she felt ignored. So, she brought up the representation issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During a meeting with residents of the city's Bostandyk District, the woman stated that over the past two years, she had submitted more than 200 requests to the akimat (local government administration) and other government agencies regarding the construction of a housing development. However, she claimed that "the akimat and all state bodies do not hear" the residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two hundred requests! Wow. But then the Akim’s response… he says he has women in, um, leading positions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two hundred requests! Wow. But then the Akim's response... he says he has women in, um, leading positions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Akim Erbolat Dossaev responded by saying that Almaty is a unique city in this regard. ... But women do hold leading positions in the akimat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s right. He said Almaty is unique, mentioned two female district akims, department heads, even his deputy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. He said Almaty is unique, mentioned two female district akims, department heads, even his deputy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Akim Erbolat Dossaev responded by saying that Almaty is a unique city in this regard. "In Almaty, I believe we are the most unique. I have two district akims who are women. My department heads are women. My deputy (Asem Nusupova " ed.) is a woman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But the part that, like, really got me, he says, "Honestly, I trust them more than men because they are reliable." What?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the part that, like, really got me, he says, Honestly, I trust them more than men because they are reliable. What?!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Honestly, I trust them more than men because they are reliable," Dossaev stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that’s, uh, quite a statement to make publicly, isn't it? It suggests a strong personal bias, even if it's positive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's, uh, quite a statement to make publicly, isn't it? It suggests a strong personal bias, even if it's positive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I just... I don't know. Is he trying to say he gets it? Or is he just, like, completely missing the point?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I just... I don't know. Is he trying to say he gets it? Or is he just, like, completely missing the point?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I think, um, he’s trying to show he does value women in leadership, or at least that he thinks he does. He even wants to increase their numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think, um, he's trying to show he does value women in leadership, or at least that he thinks he does. He even wants to increase their numbers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I would like to increase their number even more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, he’s, like, saying, "Look, I do have women, and I think they're better," instead of, "Okay, point taken, we need to address systemic issues."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, he's, like, saying, Look, I do have women, and I think they're better, instead of, Okay, point taken, we need to address systemic issues.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It kinda sounds like that, doesn’t it? He acknowledges they don't have "perfect gender equality yet," but then, um, immediately pivots to his own examples.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It kinda sounds like that, doesn't it? He acknowledges they don't have perfect gender equality yet, but then, um, immediately pivots to his own examples.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So, I believe that we don't have perfect gender equality yet. But women do hold leading positions in the akimat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just so… jarring. Like, a woman calls out a problem, and he essentially says, "No, it's fine, and actually, women are better anyway."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just so... jarring. Like, a woman calls out a problem, and he essentially says, No, it's fine, and actually, women are better anyway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it’s a very specific, almost defensive, way to address a broader structural concern, uh, that the resident raised.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a very specific, almost defensive, way to address a broader structural concern, uh, that the resident raised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I’m still stuck on "I trust them more than men." Is that, like, a compliment or just, um, weird?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I'm still stuck on I trust them more than men. Is that, like, a compliment or just, um, weird?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's certainly not a typical, uh, politically nuanced response, you know? It's very candid.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's certainly not a typical, uh, politically nuanced response, you know? It's very candid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Candid, yeah. It definitely made me, um, stop and think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Candid, yeah. It definitely made me, um, stop and think.
